Dear Ms. Madaj:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
1/11/21-1/15/21. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For repeat violations, why the prior CAP failed to achieve compliance.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
from the American Heart Association or the American Red
Cross or other institution approved by the department.
One of four foster home files reviewed did not contain verification of CPR/FA
training.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of four foster home files reviewed contained a renewal report that was
completed 6 days prior to the license expiration date.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(a) Prior approval from the certifying agency authorizing the
placement of a child in the home.
One of three borrowed home files reviewed contained documentation that was dated
after the youth’s placement in the home.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the department's
licensing authority within 5 working days in the manner
prescribed by the department.
One of four special evaluation reports reviewed was not initiated an investigation
until 29 days after receipt of initial allegation.
4

R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and parenting
time that contains, at a minimum, all of the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child
and the foster parent in the foster parent's home at least once
every month.
Two of six foster care files reviewed were missing one monthly home visit with the
youth.
Repeat violation - LSR dated 3/17/2020, CAP approved 3/25/2020.
R 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care.
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health
care as required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental, and
mental health care provided shall be documented in the
youth's record.
Two of three independent living records reviewed contained documentation that a
youth’s dental was completed outside of the required timeframe.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(1) There shall be a mutually agreed upon contract between the
youth and the agency specifying all of the following:
(d) The location where the youth is living.
Three of three independent living files reviewed were missing the youth’s location on
the contracts.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth
and the social service worker. The contract shall be
reviewed and updated at least once every 90 calendar
days and a copy provided to the youth.
One of three independent living files reviewed contained one contract that was not
updated within the required timeframe.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
5

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06B FTM PRACTICE GUIDANCE
Documentation
The DHHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the
safety plan, and any recommendations made for the family
during the FTM. The DHHS-1105, FTM Report, must be
completed for every FTM.
• These documents must also be uploaded into MISACWIS.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
MiSACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven business
days of the FTM.
One of six foster care files reviewed was missing one DHHS-1105.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Parents and Youth
over 14-Years Old
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or
later must have signatures from all appropriate case
members within 30 days of the report date.
Two of six open foster care case files reviewed contained one treatment plan with
signatures dated outside of the 30-day requirement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED –LSR dated 3/17/2020, CAP approved
3/25/2020 and LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved 3/1/19 at which time MISEP
6.33(c) was cited.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
One foster home inspection report indicated that the family was completing a CAP to
obtain rabies vaccinations for their dog, but the recommendation section stated that
the family was in full compliance. The wording should include that the family will be
in full compliance upon completion of the CAP in place.
6

One foster home inspection report contained information from a previous report that
was no longer accurate. Closer review of reports was recommended.
A recommendation was made to document within the file if a delay in obtaining
signatures from foster parents/parents is related to COVID issues.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Consultation was provided regarding including a biological parent with whom a youth
is placed in treatment planning when the there is an open foster care case involving
the other parent.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. This CAP was provided in response to a
violation of R 400.4309(1) as cited in SIR 2020C0103033. It was determined through
file review, policy review, and interviews that the agency is in compliance with the
CAP.
While reviewing a special evaluation report, it was determined that a licensing
investigation be initiated regarding the findings of fact documented. This
investigation is currently underway. No other concerns were noted through file
review or staff interviews.
Analyst findings:
The DCWL Field Analyst identified one safety concerns during the course of the
inspection. This concern was due to a water heater being located in the closet of a
bedroom in the home. The water heater was not in a foster child’s bedroom. A
variance was requested by the agency in response to this concern.
7

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
